member.summary: Zooms at the specified pivot.
member.param: The flags, for example ZoomAndPanMode.X | ZoomAndPanMode.NoFit, will zoom only in the x axis and will ignore the fit to bounds feature.
The pivot, is the reference point, the center where the zoom operation is calculated.

The scale factor, requires direction param to be , then we can define the scale factor, for example 0.8 means to decrease the viewport 20%, and 1.2 means to increase the viewport 20%, this is method normally used in touch devices when pinching.

member.name: T:LiveChartsCore.Generators.BaseChartPointState
member.summary: Represents the base state of a chart point, including its name and associated visual state setters.
member.remarks: This class provides a foundational structure for managing the state of a chart point. It includes a name to identify the state and a collection of setters that define visual properties for the state. The property allows customization of visual state properties, while the property provides a descriptive identifier for the state.

member.summary: The sate name.

member.name: T:LiveChartsCore.Generators.BaseChartPointState.SetterCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects, with additional functionality for managing visual state properties.
member.remarks: This class extends to provide a specialized collection of objects. It includes methods for converting the collection into a for use in visual state management.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Generators.BaseChartPointState.SetterCollection.Name
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an empty collection.

member.name: M:LiveChartsCore.Generators.BaseChartPointState.SetterCollection.AsStatesCollection
member.summary: Converts the current collection of drawn property sets into a dictionary of visual states.
member.remarks: This method creates a dictionary where each entry corresponds to a drawn property set in the current collection. The resulting dictionary can be used to represent visual states in a structured format.
member.returns: A containing the visual states represented by the current collection. Each state is keyed by the property name and includes its corresponding value.

member.remarks: This class is designed to store a key-value pair where the key is represented by the property name and the value can be of any type. It is commonly used for scenarios where dynamic or loosely-typed data needs to be stored and accessed.

member.name: T:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.Observers.SeriesSourceObserver
member.summary: Observes a collection of source objects and manages a corresponding collection of series objects, providing synchronization between the two collections.
member.remarks: This class is designed to map source objects to series objects and track changes in the source collection. It supports collections that implement for automatic synchronization of additions, removals, and replacements. If the source collection does not implement , the mapping is performed once during initialization.
member.param: A function that maps a source object to an object.
A function that determines whether the observer can build series from the source collection.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.RenderingSettings.UseGPU
member.summary: Indicates whether hardware acceleration is used, this will only work if the platform and device support it. This is ignored in Avalonia and Uno-Desktop because in those platforms the frame rate and rendering cadence is determined by them.

members.member: Indicates whether the rendering cadence should be aligned with the display refresh rate, GPU acceleration is required for this to work. This is ignored in Avalonia and Uno-Desktop because in those platforms the frame rate and rendering cadence is determined by them.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.RenderingSettings.LiveChartsRenderLoopFPS
member.summary: Defines the desired frames per second when using the LiveCharts render loop, this has no effect when is true and is true. Default is 60. This is ignored in Avalonia, the frame rate is determined by Avalonia itself.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.RenderingSettings.ShowFPS
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart should show the frames per second and more information about the rendering in the top left corner of the chart. Default is false.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.Sketches.ICartesianAxis.LabelsDensity
member.summary: Gets or sets the labels density, it is a factor that determines the distance between labels when calculated by the library, 0 is the most dense any value greater than 0 will make the labels to be more separated, values less than 0 will make the labels to overlap (labels rotation could prevent overlapping). Default value is 0.85.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.Sketches.ICartesianAxis.MinZoomDelta
member.summary: Gets or sets the min zoom delta, the minimum difference between the max and min visible limits of the axis. default is null and null means that the library will calculate this value based on the current data.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.Sketches.ICartesianAxis.BouncingDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance that the axis can be panned beyond its limits, the unit is percentage of the chart width or height depending on the axis orientation, default is 0.25 which means that the axis can be panned 25% of the chart width or height beyond its limits.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum step, the step defines the interval between every separator in the axis, LiveCharts will calculate it automatically based on the chart data and the chart size size, if the calculated step is less than the then will be used as the axis step, default is 0.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.Sketches.IPlane.ForceStepToMin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the axis should use the as the actual step of the axis, if true, the library will not calculate the step of the axis automatically, instead it will use the value in the property. Be careful when setting this property to true, it might cause performance issues if the step is too small for the current data in the chart. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the unit with, it means the width of every point (if the series requires it) in the chart values scale, this value should normally be 1, unless you are plotting in a custom scale, default is 1.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value visible in the axis, any point less than this value will be hidden, set it to null (or double.NaN) to use a value based on the smaller value in the chart.

member.name: P:LiveChartsCore.Kernel.Sketches.IPlane.MaxLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value visible in the axis, any point greater than this value will be hidden, set it null (or double.NaN) to use a value based on the greater value in the chart.
